info.description: I use a private {{ matomo }} instance to collect some data about the usage of this site. This data is only used to improve the site and get some statistics. I plan to share these statistics regularly here on the site and on my website. Beyond that, the data will not be shared with any third parties.
info.title: General info about the analytics I use

statistics.description: Here you will soon find some statistics about the site. Since I only recently started to collect some usage data, there is not much to show yet. However, I am planning to release some statistics about the site every couple of months.
statistics.title: Statistics

disable.text: Thank you for your support by allowing me to collect some data about your usage of the site.
disable.title: Disable analytics

enable.text: If you want to help me improve the site, you can enable analytics here, allowing me to collect some data about site usage. No personal data will be collected, profiled or shared with third parties.
enable.title: Enable analytics and support the site

export.label: Export formats
export.reason: Depending on the usage of the export feature we can try to support these formats even better. Also, if a new export format is added, we can observe how much usage changes and if that has a significant impact.

language.label: Language selection
language.reason: If I know which languages are most commonly used, I can ensure that new features are translated into those languages as quickly as possible.

pwa.label: PWA installation
pwa.reason: If a lot of people are using the site as a PWA, we know that those people are happy enough to have Rainbow Palette integrated into their workflow.

save.label: Save palette
save.reason: Until now you have to save your palette manually, if you want to keep it in the browser. However, if a lot of users save their palette regularly, an auto-save feature could be considered.

scheme.label: Color scheme
scheme.reason: Once we know which color schemes are used the most, we focus on optimizing the algorithm for them even further.

theme.label: Theme
theme.reason: Depending on which theme is most used, we mainly focus on that during development. However, both themes will still be supported.

analytics.description: This website uses a private {{ matomo }} instance to collect anonymized data about the use of the site. No personally identifiable information is collected, and all data about your usage is anonymized.
analytics.more-info-title: Get mor information about my analytics
analytics.title: Help me improve the site

message.delete-palette:
Are you sure you want to delete the palette?
It can not be restored!
message.export-css: Do you want to copy the CSS properties into your own files or create a new one?
message.export-css-copy:
The palette has been copied to your clipboard. To use the colors as CSS properties copy the contents of the clipboard to the {{ root }} of your css file.

Now you can use your colors by referencing them like:
{{ usage }}
message.export-css-file:
Move the downloaded {{ file }} file to the root of your webserver. Then link it in the head of your html file like:
{{ link }}

Now you can use your colors by referencing them like:
{{ usage }}
message.export-less: Do you want to copy the LESS variables into your own files or create a new one?

The palette has been copied to your clipboard. To use the colors as LESS variables copy the contents of the clipboard to the top of your less file.

Now you can use your colors by referencing them like:
{{ usage }}
message.export-less-file:
Move the downloaded {{ file }} file to the root of your project. Then link it in the head of your less files like:
{{ link }}

Now you can use your colors by referencing them like:
{{ usage }}
message.export-palette: How do you want to use your palette?

Now you can use your colors by referencing them like:

Now you can use your colors by referencing them like:

message.export-tailwind: Do you want to copy the colors to your existing {{ file }} or create an extra file only for your palette?
message.export-tailwind-copy:
The palette has been copied to your clipboard. To use the colors copy the contents of the clipboard to the {{ config }} file.

Check TailwindsCSS's documentation for further instructions.
message.export-tailwind-file:
Move the downloaded {{ file }} file to the root of your project. Then import the colors in your {{ config }} file like:
{{ import }}

Check TailwindCSS's documentation for further instructions.
message.request-export-format: If you find a format missing, please check if it is already requested on GitHub. If not, you can create a new issue there and I will try to add it as soon as possible.
message.test:
This is a test message for storybook.

You can use HTML to format your message.
message.update-available: A new version of Rainbow Palette is available. Do you want to update now?

development.title: Development paused
development.text: Unfortunately, at the moment I don't have much time to actively improve the tool myself. Nevertheless, I monitor the activities of the {{ github }} repository on the side. So if you have any ideas on how the tool could be expanded, want to implement new interfaces yourself or can improve my algorithms, feel free to contact me on my {{ discord }}.

list.15: Adjust colors in different formats (RGB, HSV)
list.17: Exemplary web components to preview palette

planned.text: Even though I can't develop the tool myself at the moment, I have a few features planned. These include:
planned.title: Planned features

generation.invalid-hex: You need to enter a 6-digit hex code.
generation.perfection:
No generator achieves perfect results.
Please adjust the colors to your liking.

home.text1: Generate an entire color palette from just a single color.
home.text2: Enter a hex code below or pick a color to get started.

editing.title: Editing
editing.text: After the algorithm has finished the generation, editing begins. Now you can view your palette and adjust the colors using the "tune" icon. If you just want to try it out and complete the palette later, your progress can be saved locally in your browser for later.

end.title: That's it!
end.subtitle: It's that easy to create your very own color palette.

export.title: Export
export.text: When you're finished you can export your personal palette in the format of your choice. So far this site supports both CSS variables and TailwindCSS. In addition, with each format you have the choice between the pure code or a file that you can easily integrate into your existing project.

generation.title: Generation
generation.text: Just pick your favorite color or enter your brand color and hit "generate". If you want, you can optionally select a specific color scheme, otherwise you will get a rainbow color scheme. The algorithm then starts to add more colors to match yours and generates 10 different shades for each one.

notification.copy-error: An error occurred while copying the color to your clipboard.
notification.invalid-hex: You need to enter a 6-digit hex code.
notification.tracking-allowed: Thank you for supporting the project!
notification.update-failed: An error occurred while updating the app.
